reviews.text: We stayed here in March. We were one couple and one adult plus 2 teens. We booked a studio and a 2brm apartment. They upgraded us to a 1 brm apartment. The one bedroom apartment was huge but the internal bedroom was way too hot. We had both the fans in the room running and it was uncomfortable. This is when it was quite cold outside too. In the 2 brm apartment, the safe didn't work, nor did the heatpump/air conditioning unit. So that room was also very hot. Also, I'd asked on booking and twice the week we arrived for both apartments to be on the same floor. They weren't. I wouldn't stay there again until they sorted out the heating/cooling issues.
reviews.title: Location good but facilities not great

reviews.text: The beds were also very uncomfortable. We travel a lot and haven't had such uncomfortable beds for a long time
reviews.title: Average appartment

reviews.text: Need better beds, trampoline is not very comfortable to sleep on!
reviews.title: Great Value/Great Location

reviews.text: Four of us - 3 adults & one teenager - stayed in a 2 bedroom suite for a couple of nights. We had 2 twin bed in one room and a queen in the other - would have preferred 4 twins but that probably isn't an issue for most people.
reviews.title: Fabulous Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros - roomy, reasonable decor, comfy beds, excellent location (Wellington is a great walkable city), reasonable cost parking available, clean & friendly staff. Rooms have a dishwasher and clothes washer/dryer - plus a small supply of powers for both.
reviews.title: Fantastic service
Great location, clean, but bit rundown
reviews.text: We stayed here last weekend for 3 nights during the school holidays in a 2 bedroom apartment (room 103) - 2 adults and 3 young kids (9,7 and 3)
Positives first, Very good central location, comes out onto Lambton Quay, apartment was clean, staff very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Odd lack of service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Negatives, Room furnishings could do with an update. Lounge sofa was cream and stained, and the main squab had a big rip in it. We were on the first floor and the room was noisy with a main bustop outside. Fridge in room was noisy as was the main power board (humming all the time). Also hot water cylinder in the second bedroom creates noise for kids in here. Heating was very basic, a wall mounted fan heater in the lounge, which heated the room very quickly, but the bedrooms especially can get hot and stuffy, given no air movement. Gym area not that great - didn't appear to have any decent ventilation (converted apartment). Car parking for the hotel is fairly restricted, only about 10 car parks outside of the hotel, then you park in the Wilson carpark down the road.
reviews.title: Great Location and Quality Room

reviews.text: Overall we enjoyed our visit, and probably would stay here again (hopefully there are more modern rooms - maybe we had just lucked out with room choice?), because we haven't seen anything else that accommodates a family of 5 in a fairly central location....maybe need to do more research next time.
reviews.title: we'll be back

reviews.text: The rooms are great, large, clean and well appointed with all you could want.
reviews.title: top notch

reviews.text: We were looking for a two bedroom, two bathroom suite in central Wellington and this definitely fit the bill. Our suite was very comfortable, clean, and the staff was very helpful. I thought I had booked a suite with two rooms with queen beds (perhaps I made a mistake and didn't), so originally we were sent to a suite with one room with twin beds, but the lovely receptionist very nicely made a chance without any complaint. They were very helpful with directions and booking taxis for us. We didn't try breakfast so can't comment on the food. But the location couldn't be better for restaurants, and our walk to Parliament and TePapa. We were able to walk from the train station to the hotel with our rolling luggage without a problem.
reviews.title: Excellent location, very nice suites, fair price

reviews.text: We booked the CityLife Wellington at last minute, after weeks of trying to find accommodation for 3 adults and 2 children at a resonable price.
reviews.title: HUGE ROOMS

reviews.text: This hotel was perfect for us, unfortunately we didnt get to spend much time there,as the airport had been closed most of the day so we were late arriving, then left at 6.45am the next morning for the overlander train.
reviews.title: Awkward access, great room

reviews.text: Reception staff were good, no complaints.
reviews.title: A bit depressing but 2 rooms as good as we can find anywhere

reviews.text: Room great, very large, 2 ensuite bathrooms and everything we needed. 7 Yr old slept on the couch, could have slept another child it was large like the apartment.
reviews.title: Excellent location, good suites and friendly, helpful staff

reviews.text: Four of us girls (thirty-somethings!) went to Wellington to see the World of Wearable Arts show. I booked Citylife after doing a little research online. It was reasonably priced and well located. I booked directly with them, and at $261 per night for a two bedroom/1 bathroom apartment it suited us perfectly.
reviews.title: Good location for WOW

reviews.text: When we first arrived, the apartment looked clean (apart from a cobweb or two near the ceiling and some food left by previous guests in the fridge) and comfortable. Our only problem was the noise from Lambton Quay buses (and the odd drunk person making their way past the hotel), even though we were on the sixth floor.
reviews.title: Good accommodation, woeful WiFi.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is also a bit of a trek to the entertainment district of Courtney Place and Cuba Street, but we just organised taxis through reception and at $10-$15 a trip it was okay.
reviews.title: Great modern central apartment

reviews.text: We stayed in a two bedroom self-contained room. A mini-apartment really. Very comfortable, central base from which to explore Wellington, which is a beautiful and interesting city. Great staff too.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: However none of the rooms have a view of the harbour and parking at the hotel itself is (very) limited, and there is no room service. Despite this, the positives far outweigh the negatives and, but for the woeful WiFi, I'd recommend this place unequivocally.
reviews.title: Excellant hotel
